title: Test issue for prefix verification
Add tail.sh to template with terminal-agnostic colors
description:
## Summary

Move tail.sh into the template folder so it's included in generated projects, and make its color output work well across different terminal themes (light/dark).

## Tasks

1. **Move tail.sh to template/** - Copy tail.sh into template/ folder so it gets included in generated projects

2. **Add to chmod in _tasks** - Update copier.yaml _tasks to make tail.sh executable

3. **Fix terminal color compatibility** - The current color codes may not display well on all terminal themes (light vs dark backgrounds). Options:
   - Use semantic ANSI colors (e.g., default foreground/background) instead of specific RGB values
   - Detect terminal background and adapt colors
   - Use only bold/dim/underline styling without colors
   - Use tput for terminal-capability-aware color codes
   - Offer a --no-color flag

## Research Needed

- Review current color codes in tail.sh
- Determine which colors are problematic on light vs dark themes
- Choose best approach for cross-terminal compatibility

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] tail.sh exists in template/ and is copied to generated projects
- [ ] tail.sh is made executable via _tasks in copier.yaml
- [ ] Colors are readable on both light and dark terminal themes
- [ ] Fallback works gracefully if terminal doesn't support colors
close_reason: Moved tail.sh to template/, added tput-based terminal-aware colors with NO_COLOR support, added to chmod task in copier.yaml

title: Implement Q&A completion detection and answer collection
description:
## Overview
Implement logic to detect when all Q&A subtasks are completed and collect the answers for PRD generation.

## Requirements

### Completion Detection
- Query subtasks of an idea: `bd list --parent <idea-id>`
- Check status of each Q&A subtask
- Determine if ALL subtasks are closed/completed
- This can be used in a polling loop or triggered by dependency resolution

### Answer Collection
When all Q&A subtasks are closed:
- Iterate through each subtask
- Extract answers from:
  - Subtask description (if human edited it)
  - Subtask comments (use `bd comments <id>`)
- Compile answers into structured format:
  ```
  Q1: [original question]
  A1: [collected answer]
  
  Q2: [original question]
  A2: [collected answer]
  ...
  ```

### Output Format
- Return structured data suitable for PRD generation:
  - Original idea description
  - List of Q&A pairs
  - Any additional context/metadata

## Implementation Notes
- Create as reusable function for prd-pipeline.sh
- Handle case where subtask has no answer (warn but continue)
- Consider timeout/staleness detection (optional: warn if Q&A open too long)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Correctly detects when all Q&A subtasks are closed
- [ ] Extracts answers from subtask descriptions
- [ ] Extracts answers from subtask comments
- [ ] Compiles structured Q&A output
- [ ] Handles missing/empty answers gracefully
close_reason: Done: Created collect-qa.sh for Q&A completion detection and answer collection

title: Create Q&A subtask generation from idea descriptions
description:
## Overview
Implement the logic to read an idea's description and generate discovery question subtasks using prd/PRD-PROMPT.md.

## Requirements

### Input Processing
- Read the idea bead's description field
- Parse and understand the idea context

### Question Generation
- Use prd/PRD-PROMPT.md as the prompt template for generating discovery questions
- Generate 3-7 focused questions that help clarify:
  - User needs and pain points
  - Scope and constraints
  - Success criteria
  - Technical considerations
  - Edge cases

### Subtask Creation
For each generated question:
- Create a subtask using `bd create -t task --parent <idea-id>`
- Set assignee to human (or configurable)
- Title should be the question itself (truncated if needed)
- Description should include:
  - Full question text
  - Context from the original idea
  - Instructions: "Answer by editing this description or adding a comment, then close when done"

### Dependency Setup
- Each Q&A subtask should block the parent idea: `bd dep add <idea-id> <subtask-id>`
- This ensures the idea cannot be closed until all Q&A is complete

## Implementation Notes
- Create as a function/module that can be called from prd-pipeline.sh
- Use `bd show <id> --json` to read bead details
- Return list of created subtask IDs for tracking

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Reads idea description successfully
- [ ] Generates relevant discovery questions using PRD-PROMPT.md
- [ ] Creates subtasks with proper structure
- [ ] Sets up blocking dependencies correctly
- [ ] Handles edge cases (empty description, etc.)
close_reason: Done: Created generate-qa.sh and PRD-QA-PROMPT.md for Q&A subtask generation

title: Implement PRD generation and task explosion
description:
## Overview
Generate the PRD document from collected Q&A answers and explode it into implementation tasks assigned to ralph.

## Requirements

### PRD Generation
- Input: Original idea + collected Q&A pairs
- Use prd/PRD-PROMPT.md as the generation template
- Generate comprehensive PRD document including:
  - Problem statement
  - Goals and success metrics
  - User stories
  - Technical requirements
  - Implementation phases
  - Open questions/risks

### PRD Output
- Save to: `prd/PRD-[name].md`
  - [name] derived from idea title (slugified)
- Include metadata header with:
  - Source idea ID
  - Generation date
  - Q&A summary

### Task Explosion
After PRD generation:
- Parse the PRD for implementation phases/tasks
- Create beads for each major work item:
  - Epics for large phases
  - Tasks for specific implementations
- All created beads should be:
  - Assigned to ralph (--assignee ralph)
  - Linked as dependencies or children appropriately
- Reference the PRD document in task descriptions

### Idea Closure
- After successful PRD generation and task creation
- Close the original idea: `bd close <idea-id>`
- Add closing comment summarizing what was created

## Implementation Notes
- Use Claude to generate PRD content with prd/PRD-PROMPT.md
- Consider using existing generate-prd.sh as reference
- Task explosion should be intelligent about granularity

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Generates well-structured PRD document
- [ ] Saves PRD to correct location with proper naming
- [ ] Creates implementation tasks from PRD
- [ ] Tasks are properly assigned to ralph
- [ ] Original idea is closed with summary
close_reason: Done: Created generate-prd-from-qa.sh for PRD generation and task explosion

title: Use git config for default author_name and author_email in copier wizard
description:
## Summary

When running the copier wizard, the author_name and author_email prompts should default to the user's git config values if available.

## Current Behavior

- author_name defaults to "Developer"
- author_email defaults to "dev@example.com"

## Expected Behavior

- author_name should default to $(git config --global user.name) if available, else "Developer"
- author_email should default to $(git config --global user.email) if available, else "dev@example.com"

## Implementation

In copier.yaml, use Jinja2 expressions with shell commands to fetch git config values:

```yaml
author_name:
  type: str
  help: Your name
  default: "{{ 'git config --global user.name' | shell | trim or 'Developer' }}"

author_email:
  type: str
  help: Your email
  default: "{{ 'git config --global user.email' | shell | trim or 'dev@example.com' }}"
```

Note: Need to verify copier supports the `shell` filter. If not, may need an alternative approach.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Running copier shows git username as default for author_name (if git configured)
- [ ] Running copier shows git email as default for author_email (if git configured)
- [ ] Falls back to "Developer" / "dev@example.com" if git not configured
- [ ] Test with and without git config set
close_reason: Implemented git config defaults using copier-template-extensions ContextHook

title: Create prd-pipeline.sh orchestration script
description:
## Overview
Create the main orchestration script that ties together all PRD pipeline components into a continuous loop.

## Requirements

### Main Loop Structure
```bash
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# prd-pipeline.sh - Automated PRD generation pipeline

while true; do
    # 1. Check for ideas assigned to prd-pipeline
    # 2. Process each idea through the pipeline
    # 3. Sleep and repeat
done
```

### Idea Intake
- Run `bd ready --assignee prd-pipeline` to find ideas ready for processing
- Filter to only process ideas (not tasks/epics)
- Track which ideas are already being processed (avoid duplicate processing)

### Pipeline States
Handle ideas in different stages:

1. **New idea (no Q&A subtasks)**: 
   - Generate Q&A subtasks (use task copier-project-archetype-65m logic)
   - Mark as "in Q&A phase"

2. **In Q&A phase (has open subtasks)**:
   - Check if all Q&A subtasks are closed
   - If not, skip (waiting for human)
   - Could log status for visibility

3. **Q&A complete (all subtasks closed)**:
   - Collect answers (use task copier-project-archetype-5ic logic)
   - Generate PRD and explode tasks (use task copier-project-archetype-8rx logic)
   - Close idea

### State Tracking
- Use bead labels or a local state file to track pipeline phase
- Possible labels: `prd:qa-pending`, `prd:qa-complete`, `prd:generating`
- Or store state in `.prd-pipeline-state.json`

### Error Handling
- Catch and log errors for each idea
- Don't let one failed idea block others
- Consider retry logic with backoff

### Logging
- Log pipeline activity for debugging
- Show which ideas are being processed
- Report on Q&A waiting status

## Configuration
- POLL_INTERVAL: How often to check for new ideas (default: 60s)
- DRY_RUN: Option to simulate without making changes

## File Location
- Create at: `scripts/prd-pipeline.sh`
- Make executable

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Continuously polls for prd-pipeline assigned ideas
- [ ] Correctly identifies idea pipeline stage
- [ ] Orchestrates Q&A generation for new ideas
- [ ] Detects Q&A completion and triggers PRD generation
- [ ] Handles errors gracefully
- [ ] Includes logging for observability
- [ ] Can be run as background process
close_reason: Done: Created prd-pipeline.sh orchestration script with full async workflow

title: Run prerequisite checks without adding shell script to generated project
description:
## Summary

Currently check-prerequisites.sh is copied into the generated project and run as a _tasks step. We want to run prerequisite checks during copier generation without leaving a shell script in the generated project.

## Current Behavior

- check-prerequisites.sh is copied to the generated project
- It's run as a _tasks step: `./check-prerequisites.sh`
- The script remains in the project after generation

## Desired Behavior

- Prerequisite checks run during copier generation
- No check-prerequisites.sh file left in the generated project

## Possible Approaches

1. **Copier extension (Python)** - Add a Jinja extension or context that runs checks and reports results
2. **_tasks with inline commands** - Run checks inline in _tasks without a script file
3. **Post-generation hook** - Use copier's task system to run checks from the template directory (not copied)
4. **Add to _exclude** - Keep script in template/ but exclude from copy, reference by full path in _tasks

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Prerequisite checks still run during project generation
- [ ] No check-prerequisites.sh in the generated project
- [ ] Clear error messages if prerequisites missing
- [ ] Works on Linux/macOS
close_reason: Implemented prerequisite checks as Copier extension instead of shell script

title: PRD pipeline creates tasks without assigning to ralph
description:
When creating a new project via the PRD pipeline, the generated shell script creates beads tasks but does not assign them to ralph. This causes the ralph loop to have no tasks to work on, requiring manual intervention to assign all tasks to ralph.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Use the PRD pipeline to create a new project
2. Complete the interview process
3. Observe the generated bd create commands in the shell script
4. Note that tasks are created without --assignee=ralph

**Expected behavior:**
Tasks created by the PRD pipeline should be automatically assigned to ralph so they appear in ralph's work queue.

**Actual behavior:**
Tasks are created unassigned, causing ralph loop to have no work.
close_reason: Fixed by adding explicit CRITICAL reminders in generate-prd-from-interview.sh and PRD-PROMPT.md that all bd create commands MUST include --assignee=ralph

title: Implement PRD pipeline with async human Q&A via subtasks
description:
Create an automated PRD pipeline that:

1. **Idea Intake**: Picks up ideas assigned to 'prd-pipeline' via `bd ready --assignee prd-pipeline`

2. **Async Q&A via Subtasks**: Instead of interactive interviews, the pipeline:
   - Reads the idea description
   - Uses prd/PRD-PROMPT.md to generate discovery questions
   - Creates subtasks for each question (assigned to a human)
   - Human answers questions by updating the subtask description or adding comments
   - Human closes subtask when answered
   - Pipeline waits for all Q&A subtasks to close (uses dependency blocking)

3. **PRD Generation**: Once all Q&A subtasks are closed:
   - Collects answers from subtasks
   - Generates PRD document to prd/PRD-[name].md using prd/PRD-PROMPT.md
   - Explodes PRD into implementation tasks/epics assigned to 'ralph'
   - Closes the original idea

**Scripts needed**:
- `prd-pipeline.sh` - Loop that runs `bd ready --assignee prd-pipeline`

**Workflow**:
```
Human creates idea (assignee: prd-pipeline)
    ↓
prd-pipeline.sh picks it up
    ↓
Creates Q&A subtasks (assignee: human, blocks: idea)
    ↓
Human answers async, closes subtasks
    ↓
Pipeline detects all Q&A done
    ↓
Generates PRD using prd/PRD-PROMPT.md, explodes to tasks (assignee: ralph)
    ↓
ralph.sh picks up implementation work
```
close_reason: Done: Implemented full async PRD pipeline with generate-qa.sh, collect-qa.sh, generate-prd-from-qa.sh, and prd-pipeline.sh
